vulnerability_findings.name: arbitrary-send
vulnerability_findings.message:
EtherGet.withdrawEther (patch_18.sol#21-23) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- owner.transfer(address(this).balance) (patch_18.sol#22)

vulnerability_findings.name: arbitrary-send
vulnerability_findings.message:
EtherGet.getTokens (patch_18.sol#25-29) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- require(bool,string)(addr.call.value(0)(),Low level call failed) (patch_18.sol#27)

vulnerability_findings.name: unused-return
vulnerability_findings.message:
EtherGet.withdrawTokens (patch_18.sol#16-19) does not use the value returned by external calls:
	-tc.transfer(owner,tc.balanceOf(this)) (patch_18.sol#18)

vulnerability_findings.name: calls-loop
vulnerability_findings.message:
EtherGet.getTokens has external calls inside a loop:
	- require(bool,string)(addr.call.value(0)(),Low level call failed) (patch_18.sol#27)

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function transfer(address _to, uint _value) public returns (bool success);

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function balanceOf(address _owner) public view returns (uint balance);

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
external-function
solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in patch_18.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.19 (patch_18.sol#1): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in EtherGet.getTokens (patch_18.sol#25-29):
	-require(bool,string)(addr.call.value(0)(),Low level call failed) patch_18.sol#27
